glosses: To quickly shake a carpet, a rug etc.
To hit two things to each other.
To scramble, to whisk, to beat, to whip a liquid matter with a utensil.

etymology: From Ottoman Turkish چرپمق (çırpmak), derived from çarpmak (“to hit, to strike, to bump”), from Proto-Turkic *čap- or Proto-Turkic *čalp- (“to hit, to steal, to plunder”).
